intro: Cassebeera argentea, commonly known as silver cassava, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
